title: Third Law Hub - Published
content:
[[div class="window-box window-box-list window-box-collapsible"]]

[[=]]
[[# published]]
++ Published
[[/=]]

This page contains a list of every Third Law article, sorted by date of publication. For tale series with hubs, the hub is listed next to each entry in italics, rather than as its own entry.

----

[[=]]
[[# 2015]]
[[collapsible show="+ 2015" hide="- 2015" hideLocation="top"]]
[[/=]]

[[<]]
* **[[[grant-request-for-utilization-of-electro-thaumic-computers-t| Grant Request for Utilization of Electro-thaumic Computers...]]]** --  How do you deal with a growing demand for exorcisms? Prometheus Labs has the answer: build a better exorcist. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[grant-request-for-the-construction-of-an-interstellar-scienc| Grant Request for the Construction of an Interstellar Science Vessel]]]** -- Prometheus Labs has always dreamed big, and there's nothing around bigger than space. So the logical conclusion is to build a starship powered by a black hole. //Written by GreenWolf//
[[/<]]

[[/collapsible]]

----

[[=]]
[[# 2016]]
[[collapsible show="+ 2016" hide="- 2016" hideLocation="top"]]
[[/=]]

[[<]]
* **[[[scp-2176| SCP-2176 - Ghostlight™]]]** -- It's a lightbulb. Filled with ghosts. It's a ghostlight. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[Avatara]]]** -- After life is death. After death is rebirth. After rebirth is causing death. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[grant-request-for-investigating-the-potential-application-of |Grant Request for Investigating the Application of...]]]** -- In 1988, Prometheus Labs unearthed the corpse of a god. This is what they planned to do with it. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[scp-2970 |SCP-2970 - Holy Misplacement]]]** -- An immortal missionary, last survivor of a religion long lost to the ages, begs to be made whole. But how much does he truly know? //Written by TyGently//
* **[[[Operation AZURE PEREGRINE]]]** -- Mobile Task Force Tau-5 "Samsara" in action. //Written by sirpudding.//
* **[[[The Lord of Endowments]]]** -- The god of transhumanism. //Written by sirpudding//
* **[[[Samsara]]]** -- The Warrior seeks revenge. Tau-5 seeks humanity. Neither of them realize that they are pawns of a higher force seeking to become whole. //Written by A Random Day and TyGently//
* **[[[grant-request-for-genetically-engineering-low-cost-organic-a| Grant Request for Genetically Engineering Low-cost Organic Automatons...]]]** -- "Slave" is such an outdated term. We prefer the name All-Natural Automatons^^TM^^. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[scp-2308|SCP-2308 - Futures Trading]]]** -- As it turns out, time travel isn't a safe investment strategy after all. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[The Bard of Ambrose]]]** -- After years of work, Prometheus Labs has finally succeeded in creating an artificial intelligence capable of thinking like a person. The only problem is that it thinks it doesn't think at all. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[The Analog Kid]]]** -- What's the difference between a hivemind and two-way telepathy? Is there a difference? The answer may lie inside an abandoned machine shop in Three Portlands. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[T Minus]]]** -- //[[[guns-pointed-hub |Guns Pointed at the Head of God]]]// -- in 1998, Prometheus Labs built a weapon with enough firepower to kill a god. Now the clock is ticking for the titan. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[Moonlighting]]]** -- Building an android for an art show is clearly the best way to get back at your dad. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[The Fountain of Lamneth]]]** -- You wouldn't download a car, so why would you download Cthulhu? //Written by Taffeta//

----

+++ Third Law Hub posted -- Third Law officially becomes a canon

* **[[[Operation LLEWYN DARK]]]** -- When a contractual mind control satellite run by demons is struck down by a meteoroid, it's up to the Foundation to do some emergency maintenance. //Written by Taffeta//
* **[[[scp-2630| SCP-2630 - Stock of a Sort]]]** -- The market seems awfully bullish today. //Written by Taffeta//
* **[[[scp-2820| SCP-2820 - Vaishnavastra]]]** -- The Lord makes his presence known in many forms - including an AI-controlled death ray. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[To Be Noir Not To Be]]]** -- There are only two things I hate about this job. The plasma cannon cleanups and the fanfiction reading. //Written by Taffeta//
* **[[[Under Control]]]** -- A young medium finds himself at the intersection of geas, magic drugs, necromancy, and unethical business practices. //Written by TyGently//
[[/<]]

[[/collapsible]]

----

[[=]]
[[# 2017]]
[[collapsible show="+ 2017" hide="- 2017" hideLocation="top"]]
[[/=]]

[[<]]
* **[[[Hypervelocity]]]** -- An adrenaline junkie snorts demons like cocaine and robs a cursed bank. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[preliminary-report |Preliminary Report of J. C. Randall...]]]** -- In 1927, Doctor John Carver Randall led a team of experts on an expedition to explore the multiverse. They never returned. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[make-portland-weirder| Make Portland Weirder]]]** -- During a massive music festival in 1970, a Foundation agent inadvertently ends up in Three Portlands and finds the UIU already waiting for her. //Written by Jacob Conwell//
* **[[[three-portlands-hub|UIU Location Dossier — "Three Portlands"]]]** -- Three Portlands is an independent city-state and the largest paranormal enclave adjacent to the Western Hemisphere. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[scp-2664| SCP-2664 - Redline]]]** -- //[[[guns-pointed-hub |Guns Pointed at the Head of God]]]// -- In 1950, Joseph Stalin demanded a weapon for world domination. GRU Division "P" built a weapon for world peace. The year is now 1963, and that weapon wants the world. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[Permanent Waves]]]** -- //[[[unusual-investigations| Unusual Investigations]]]// -- A couple of UIU agents, a bomb, and a chain-smoker. Just an average week in Three Portlands. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[scp-2897| SCP-2897 - The Bard of Analytics]]]** -- What do you do with an AI capable of thinking that it doesn't think at all? The Department of Analytics thinks it has the answer. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[A Confluence of Clandestine Conferences]]]** -- //[[[comedown machine hub | Comedown Machine]]]// -- Intro to fast food espionage. //Written by TyGently//
* **[[[uiu-file-2014-014|UIU File: 2014-014]]]** -- There's a big gentle shark who only wants to get away and a bunch of crazy technocultists who want to get metaphysical with it. //Written by NatVoltaic and LordStonefish//
* **[[[T Plus]]]** -- //[[[guns-pointed-hub |Guns Pointed at the Head of God]]]// -- [Pending Rewrite] -- Prometheus Labs is out of luck. And out of time. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[Deus Vulture]]]** -- //[[[guns-pointed-hub |Guns Pointed at the Head of God]]]// -- [Pending Rewrite] -- Twenty years after the destruction of Prometheus Labs, the weapon they built is obsolete. This is the arms race of the new age. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[Conqueror Worm]]]** -- //[[[guns-pointed-hub |Guns Pointed at the Head of God]]]// -- The Chaos Insurgency finds God. And she’s hungry. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[scp-2350| SCP-2350 - From the Mind of Malinalxochitl]]]** -- At some point in the 1950s, the United States weaponized the concept of mosquitoes. Not the mosquitoes themselves - but the //concept.// //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[unicorn-horn| 'Unicorn Horn' (HYTCH/8FNE6/B77KT)]]]** -- Marshall, Carter and Dark discover that unicorn horns are amazing contraceptives, and take the inevitable equine body horror to its logical conclusion. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[A Farewell to Kings]]]** -- //[[[unusual-investigations| Unusual Investigations]]]// -- The chase is on as Agent Green and the UIU hunt down the individual responsible for planting the memetic bomb in Three Portlands. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[Slow Animals]]]** -- //[[[comedown machine hub | Comedown Machine]]]// -- Casey kills a man. //Written by TyGently//
* **[[[Moving Pictures]]]** -- //[[[unusual-investigations| Unusual Investigations]]]// -- The UIU's hunt for the Three Portlands Bomber culminates in a climactic wizard duel in a museum of illegal art. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[Abstract Naught]]]** -- Three years ago the Unusual Incidents Unit encountered a shark that ate concepts. It's November of 2017, and the investigation that this spurred is far from over. //Written by NatVoltaic//
* **[[[Terminal Velocity]]]** -- A criminal mastermind snorts demons like cocaine and hijacks an interdimensional train. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[Automatic Stop]]]** -- //[[[comedown machine hub | Comedown Machine]]]// -- Casey investigates a threat. //Written by TyGently//
* **[[[The Dedekind-Infinite Demographic]]]** -- //The Unusual Suspects// -- The Unusual Incidents Unit tackles a multiversal IP theft and the end of Samsara becomes the beginning of something much worse for the Foundation. //Written by Taffeta//
[[/<]]

[[/collapsible]]

----

[[=]]
[[# 2018]]
[[collapsible show="+ 2018" hide="- 2018" hideLocation="top"]]
[[/=]]

[[<]]
* **[[[Zeitgeist]]]** -- A day in the life of a ghost hitman, a space-drug smuggler, a psychic mob cleaner, and a junkie witch. Enter: the Chicago Spirit! //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[The End Has No End]]]** -- //[[[comedown machine hub | Comedown Machine]]]// -- Casey breaks and enters. //Written by TyGently//
* **[[[obskuracorps-memos |Obskuracorps Memos Acquired in Operation BLACK ROPE]]]** -- Nazi wizards frantically plot to assemble a doomsday weapon, all while being hounded by a machine that punches fascists. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[archival-document-hsa-008-advent |Archival Document — HSA-008-Advent]]]** -- Mankind has always been enamored with cool swords. The Allied Occult Initiative has to make sure the Obskuracorps doesn't sway the course of the war with one. //Written by NatVoltaic//
* **[[[a-man-of-clay-and-men-formerly-men| A Man of Clay and Men Formerly Men]]]** -- Special Operative Josef invites himself into an abandoned manor to put an end to an occult experiment. //Written by NatVoltaic//
* **[[[SCP-3457| SCP-3457 - The Rite of Solomon]]]** -- The wisdom of Solomon was unmatched among mortal men. The Foundation seeks to keep it that way. //Written by ChaoSera//
* **[[[Mutable State]]]** -- A story about a robot lady and the cryptofascist spinal-monster that hates her. //Written by The Great Hippo.//
* **[[[Intermission|Intermission: World Unglued]]]** -- //[[[comedown machine hub | Comedown Machine]]]// -- We interrupt this program for an emergency broadcast... //Written by TyGently//
* **[[[the-seltzorcism |Overheard At Deer]]]** -- Deer College is the premier occult college adjacent to the Northweastern United States. It is also the only one to be haunted by a terrible seltzer water. //Written by ch00bakka and A Random Day//
* **[[[the-necromancer| The Necromancer]]]** -- A grouchy necromancer and her harried intern disrespect the ghost of John Maynard Keynes. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[portlands-roller-derby|Portlands Derby Teams (Ranked By How Much They Scare Me)]]]** -- Three Portlands has more roller derby teams per capita than anywhere else in the world, and all of them scare me shitless. //Written by ch00bakka//
* **[[[Vital Signs]]]** -- //[[[unusual-investigations| Unusual Investigations]]]// -- A clandestine meeting in a coffee shop, an excursion to a library outside of space, and an illegal search of the headquarters of a community leader. How far will one UIU agent go to repay a favor? //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[Suspect Ratio]]]** -- //The Unusual Suspects// -- Pulling some Foundation strings, the Unit finds out just who their criminal really is -- and more importantly, what she is. //Written by Taffeta//
[[/<]]

[[/collapsible]]

----

[[=]]
[[# 2019]]
[[collapsible show="+ 2019" hide="- 2019" hideLocation="top"]]
[[/=]]

[[<]]
* **[[[prank-war-one|The Great Rugby Prank War: Part One: The Pranking Menace]]]** -- Deer and ICSUT Portlands compete each year in a contest of physical, mystical, and mental skill, each school trying to prove their superiority. Also, there are sports, I guess. //Written by ch00bakka//
* **[[[barrels-of-prose|Barrels of Prose and Slugs of Pulp]]]** -- Writing space operas is just a slippery slope to fighting against calligraphy mages for your life. That and writing more space operas. //Written by NatVoltaic//
* **[[[SCP-4566|SCP-4566: The Mark of Xerrox]]]** -- Assassination is so passé—the hot new trend in the Chaos Insurgency is making your enemies fictional. //Written by ch00bakka//
* **[[[prank-war-two|The Great Rugby Prank War: Part Two: Prank Hard with a Vengeance]]]** -- Deer and ICSUT Portlands compete each year in a contest of physical, mystical, and mental skill, each school trying to prove their superiority. Also, there are sports, I guess. //Written by ch00bakka//
* **[[[minneapolis-burns| Minneapolis Burns]]]** -- //[[[florence-thorne-hub| The Phoenix, The Nightingale, and The Magpies]]]// -- Florence Elsinger sets the Twin Cities ablaze, and learns the hard way why fire is used to fight fire. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[unexpected-interview| An Unexpected Interview]]]** -- //[[[florence-thorne-hub| The Phoenix, The Nightingale, and The Magpies]]]// -- Florence Elsinger conducts a job interview while chained to a chair. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[much-wisdom-much-grief| Much Wisdom Is Much Grief]]]** -- //[[[florence-thorne-hub| The Phoenix, The Nightingale, and The Magpies]]]// -- Florence Elsinger is called upon to stop another Occult War before it can begin. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[When Situations Degenerate]]]** -- //[[[Rich Man's World]]]// -- Mister Marshall, Mister Carter, and Mister Dark meet to discuss their finances, their families, and their futures. //Written by ch00bakka//
* **[[[thunders-fist-solomons-hand| Thunder's Fist, Solomon's Hand]]]** -- //[[[florence-thorne-hub| The Phoenix, The Nightingale, and The Magpies]]]// -- Florence Elsinger punches a Nazi. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[Get Out Of Her Way]]]** -- //[[[Rich Man's World]]]// -- Iris Black breaks her wrist, the speed limit, and several federal statutes regarding public use of thaumaturgy to make it to class on time. //Written by ch00bakka//
* **[[[individual-efficacy| Individual Efficacy]]]** -- //[[[florence-thorne-hub| The Phoenix, The Nightingale, and The Magpies]]]// -- Florence Elsinger struggles to adapt to life beneath Lake Superior.
* **[[[finding-scalpel| Finding A Scalpel]]]** -- //[[[florence-thorne-hub| The Phoenix, The Nightingale, and The Magpies]]]// -- Florence Elsinger receives some solemn advice from a Golem, which helps her finally master her powers. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[greater-good-necessary-evil| The Greater Good, and Other Necessary Evils]]]** -- //[[[florence-thorne-hub| The Phoenix, The Nightingale, and The Magpies]]]// -- Florence Elsinger has a crisis of faith. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[A-SCP-AB| All Skippers Are Bastards]]]** -- //[[[florence-thorne-hub| The Phoenix, The Nightingale, and The Magpies]]]// -- Florence Elsinger learns the truth. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[The Chosen Few]]]** -- //[[[speed demon hub | Speed Demon]]]// -- The Rookie travels to Three Portlands for a drink, but the UIU have other plans. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[Morphine Machine]]]** -- //[[[speed demon hub | Speed Demon]]]// -- In order to track down her ex, the Rookie must enlist the help of the Black Queen. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[Loud, Lawless, and Lost]]]** -- //[[[speed demon hub | Speed Demon]]]// -- The Rookie and the Black Queen launch a heist against Oneiroi, Inc., but they may get more than they bargained for. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[The Revelation]]]** -- //[[[speed demon hub | Speed Demon]]]// -- The Rookie struggles to escape the clutches of Natasha Tokyopop. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[Truth Is Sin]]]** -- //[[[speed demon hub | Speed Demon]]]// -- The Rookie makes a deal with the DJ. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[The Vice Girls]]]** -- //[[[speed demon hub | Speed Demon]]]// -- Take a trip down memory lane and learn how the Rookie and Natasha Tokyopop first fell into each other's orbits. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[Rise and Repent]]]** -- //[[[speed demon hub | Speed Demon]]]// -- Faced with the prospect of losing Natasha to a furry, the Rookie takes drastic measures. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[Ecstasy and Exorcism]]]** -- //[[[speed demon hub | Speed Demon]]]// -- The Rookie makes terrible life choices. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[Hard Machine]]]** -- //[[[speed demon hub | Speed Demon]]]// -- The Black Queen gets to know the Rookie inside and out. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[when-parallel-lines-diverge|When Parallel Lines Diverge]]]** -- Two UIU agents find themselves going in the same direction along different paths. //Written by Jacob Conwell and GreenWolf//
* **[[[Threat of Joy]]]** -- //[[[comedown machine hub | Comedown Machine]]]// -- Casey seeks unlikely allies. //Written by TyGently//
* **[[[They Laid Down The Law]]]** -- //[[[Rich Man's World]]]// -- Six or eight thousand years ago, two men bound a god. Four thousand years ago, their descendants almost lost it. //Written by ch00bakka//
* **[[[end of an era|Interlude: End of an Era]]]** -- //[[[comedown machine hub | Comedown Machine]]]// -- //Written by Jacob Conwell//
* **[[[Death Perception]]]** -- As Tau-5 struggle to fit into Site-30's Halloween party, a strange memory puts them on the path of paranormal self-discovery. //Written by A Random Day and TyGently//
[[/<]]

[[/collapsible]]

----

[[=]]
[[# 2020]]
[[collapsible show="+ 2020" hide="- 2020" hideLocation="top"]]
[[/=]]

[[<]]
* **[[[The Powers That Bark]]]** -- When Tau-5 adopts a new, four-legged trooper, its most dangerous member has a crisis of faith. //Written by TyGently and A Random Day//
* **[[[whats-going-down|Everybody Look What's Going Down]]]** -- The Ancient and Most Noble Order of Gormogons is called upon to annihilate a secret Nazi UFO base. //Written by ch00bakka//
* **[[[australian-rules|Australian Rules Drag Racing]]]** -- Demon-fueled dragsters blast through the Australian outback, their drivers dueling with blowdarts and bazookas. Can one humble reporter brave the desert heat, find the story, and finally get laid? //Written by ch00bakka//
* **[[[thorne-is-born| A Thorne Is Born]]]** -- //[[[florence-thorne-hub| The Phoenix, The Nightingale, and The Magpies]]]// -- Florence Elsinger dies. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[scp-5525| SCP-5525 - The United States Government Loots Atlantis]]]** -- The United States discovers the remains of an ancient civilization and loot its armory. The Foundation and the GOC try to stop them. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[secure-facility-dossier-site-246|Secure Facility Dossier: Site-246]]]** -- The Foundation's undersea facility located beneath the freshwater sea of Lake Superior, now greatly reduced from its former glory days. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[Blind To The Big Surprise]]]** -- //[[[Rich Man's World]]]// --  Hotdogs. Office furniture. A little light bondage. Iris gets professional help; Marshall and Carter face the music. //Written by ch00bakka//
[[/<]]

[[/collapsible]]

----

[[=]]
[[# 2021]]
[[collapsible show="+ 2021" hide="- 2021" hideLocation="top"]]
[[/=]]

[[<]]
* **[[[uiu-file-2003-112|UIU File: 2003-112 (OPERATION: PANDORA)]]]** -- Designer drugs? Check. Chatty salesgolems? Check. A bullfrog friend named Jeremiah? Check. //Written by Anorrack//
* **[[[Circumstances]]]** -- //[[[unusual-investigations| Unusual Investigations]]]// --  A poor performance, a daemonic pact, and a leap of faith. What is the cost of repaying a favor, and is it worth it? //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[paramax|UIU Location Dossier — "Paramax"]]]** -- Paramax is not the most secure prison in the world, but only because it exists outside of space. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[ancestrecall|PP-NEU-0127 - "AncestRecall"]]]** -- The Abraxas Group, a Sarkic paratechnology conglomerate, has created a drug that reconnects users with their ancestral memories, and is using it for predictably nefarious purposes. //Written by ch00bakka//
* **[[[Two Between the Eyes]]]** -- A Pentagram half-gorgon and an ORIA djinn fight together to recover a cache of Soviet paraweapons from the former KGB in the middle of the War in Afghanistan. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[Latest Model Getaway Jeep]]]** -- //[[[Rich Man's World]]]// -- Iris meets the Black Queens. Marshall and Carter meet the antichrist. One of these meetings goes well. //Written by ch00bakka//
* **[[[scp-5529|SCP-5529 - Pope Joan II]]]** -- Who is the real Pope? //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[new-atlantis|New Atlantis, Arizona]]]** -- New Atlantis is an Atlantean colony located in the State of Arizona, and the capital of their revived civilization. //Written by GreenWolf and ch00bakka//
[[/<]]

[[/collapsible]]

----

[[=]]
[[# 2022]]
[[collapsible show="+ 2022" hide="- 2022" hideLocation="top"]]
[[/=]]

[[<]]
* **[[[A Little Bit Of Help]]]** -- The Oecumenicus Volgi of the Ancient and Most Noble Order of Gormogons has the best first date ever. //Written by ch00bakka//
* **[[[the-assassination-of-xyank|The Assassination of Thaddeus Xyank by the Coward Thaddeus Xyank]]]** -- The past kills the future to save the present. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[walkin-slow|Don't Go Walking Slow]]]** -- //[[[varuna-s-war|Varuna's War]]]// -- A British platoon is stuck in the Burmese Jungle. Will the enemy kill them first, or will the monsters underground? //Written by Anorrack//
* **[[[eagle-eye|The Eagle's Eye]]]** -- //[[[unusual-investigations| Unusual Investigations]]]// -- Androids are infiltrating Congress, and there's only one obvious suspect. Thorne and Spencer know that Vincent Anderson is responsible, but can they prove it? //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[falcon-flight|The Falcon's Flight]]]** -- //[[[unusual-investigations| Unusual Investigations]]]// -- The law has finally caught up with Vincent Anderson. All that's left is to catch him. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[Stairway To The Stars]]]** -- //[[[damocles|The Damocles Initiative]]]// -- Moving to space together is usually fourth date material. //Written by ch00bakka//
* **[[[harvester-of-eyes|Harvester of Eyes]]]** -- //[[[damocles|The Damocles Initiative]]]// -- {{Your Blood Is Your Own. Do Not Nourish The Earth.}} //Written by TyGently//
* **[[[workshop-of-the-telescopes|Workshop of the Telescopes]]]** -- //[[[damocles|The Damocles Initiative]]]// -- Or, Memos from the Damocles Working Group Regarding a Confection-Based Black Hole Feed System. //Written by GreenWolf and TyGently//
* **[[[SCP-6523]]] -- The Machine (ISV //Joyeuse//)** -- //[[[damocles|The Damocles Initiative]]]// -- The //Joyeuse// will arrive at Alula Borealis in 400 years. It will not return. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[Fire of Unknown Origin]]]** -- //[[[damocles|The Damocles Initiative]]]// -- In order to begin their voyage, the crew of the //Joyeuse// must first set off the largest explosion in human history. //Written by ch00bakka, GreenWolf, and TyGently//
* **[[[Burnin' For You]]]** -- //[[[damocles|The Damocles Initiative]]]// -- The //Joyeuse// catches a black hole, takes a pitstop at Pluto, and sets off into the darkness for good. //Written by ch00bakka, GreenWolf, and TyGently//
* **[[[site anvil|Secure Planet Dossier: Site Anvil]]]** -- //[[[damocles|The Damocles Initiative]]]// -- An interstellar colonization effort seeks to safeguard humanity from total destruction. Ideally, humanity will never find out. //Written by GreenWolf and TyGently//
* **[[[Prey and Obey]]]** -- //[[[speed demon hub | Speed Demon]]]// -- The Rookie finally takes the fight to Natasha. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[Jump the Gun]]]** -- //[[[speed demon hub | Speed Demon]]]// -- The Rookie battles an old rival and her new family. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[Leather Pig]]]** -- //[[[speed demon hub | Speed Demon]]]// -- The Rookie experiences the consequences of her actions. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[No One Gets Out of Her Alive]]]** -- //[[[speed demon hub | Speed Demon]]]// -- The Rookie ends up in hell. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[Contempt]]]** -- //[[[speed demon hub | Speed Demon]]]// -- The Rookie ends up in double hell. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[Escape Velocity]]]** -- //[[[speed demon hub | Speed Demon]]]// -- The Rookie finally gets everything she deserves. //Written by A Random Day//
* **[[[SCP-7890| SCP-7890 - M.T.F. S.O.L., S.N.A.F.U.]]]** -- A cartel manufactures anomalies with Lady Luck on their side. The Foundation has to upgrade to fight a new era of paracrime. //Written by Anorrack//
* **[[[art:witches-on-the-moon|Artwork: Witches on the Moon]]]** -- We spend a quarter of an hour admiring the view. //Drawn by Ralliston//
[[/<]]

[[/collapsible]]

------

[[=]]
[[# 2023]]
[[collapsible show="+ 2023" hide="- 2023" hideLocation="top"]]

[[<]]
* **[[[Point Of Delirium]]]** -- The Foundation uses unethical means of interrogation on a Scarlet Hammer mafioso. //Written by Anorrack//
* **[[[Separate Ways]]]** -- A Foundation battlemage and a necromancer attempt to contact help from inside a collapsing Three Portlands. //Written by Jacob Conwell//
* **[[[Dead Men Tell Tales]]]** -- //[[[quinn-law-hub|Dead Reckoning]]]// -- The UIU investigates the kidnapping of a Floridan politician, and Federal Necromancer Quinn Law interviews a corpse. //Written by Anorrack//
* **[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/dead-mans-hand Dead Man's Hand]** -- //[[[quinn-law-hub|Dead Reckoning]]]// -- Quinn Law encounters a god, and deals with vermin. //Written by Anorrack//
* **[[[Transposthumousism]]]** -- //Written by HarryBlank//
* **[[[NTE-2858-Cyan-Blaecca]]]** -- The GOC fights to take control of "Other London", a Victorian-era asteroid colony populated by anarcho-syndicalists. //Written by Tsercele//
* **[[[dead-mans-switch|Dead Man's Switch]]]** -- //[[[quinn-law-hub|Dead Reckoning]]]// -- Quinn finds herself in Illinois and talks to a dead man. Problem is, he was carrying a very violent hitchhiker. Now Quinn has to fight for both her life, and his death. //Written by Anorrack//
* **[[[disgusting-things|Disgusting Things You'd Never Anticipate]]]** -- //[[[Rich Man's World]]]// -- Iris Black is dead. Long live Iris Dark. //Written by ch00bakka//
* **[[[Out of Options]]]** -- A computer uses the power of narrative to make a heist go off without a hitch. But some people never stick to the plan. //Written by Anorrack//
* **[[[Voice of Rage and Ruin]]]** -- //[[[varuna-s-war|Varuna's War]]]// -- Kiran Pal and the rest of the AOI squad make their way to Japanese-held China. There they find a secret Imperial super-weapon project, about to go terribly wrong. //Written by Anorrack//
* **[[[A Crooked Brow]]]** -- The American Coast Guard battles the weather, the ocean, and the nuclear-powered whales in the freezing Bering Sea. //Written by Anorrack//
* **[[[procurement-orders-hells-heart | 1981 COLLATED PROCUREMENT ORDERS BY THE DOD IN REGARDS TO TOP SECRET PROJECT: HELL'S HEART ]]]** -- The PENTAGRAM asks Prometheus to make some nuclear fire. //Written by psychicprogrammer//
* **[[[SCP-6756|SCP-6756 - DUMP YOUR PLASTIC IN THE OCEAN]]]** -- The Foundation uses their unlimited resources the best way they know how: killing whales. //Written by Anorrack//
[[/<]]
[[/collapsible]]

* **[[[dead-mans-secrets|Dead Man's Secrets]]]** -- //[[[quinn-law-hub|Dead Reckoning]]]// -- Two men can keep a secret, if one of them is dead. What is hidden in this secret government facility? Why did Jenny come here? What mysteries will Quinn Law uncover? //Written by Anorrack//
* **[[[digging-two-graves|Digging Two Graves]]]** -- //[[[quinn-law-hub|Dead Reckoning]]]// -- A “brief” interstitial where a necromancer and a corpse talk about death. //Written by Anorrack//
* **[[[Dead Man Walking]]]** -- //[[[quinn-law-hub|Dead Reckoning]]]// -- A maximum security facility under siege and a human sacrifice under an eclipse. It's a good day to die, as long as your name isn't Quinn Law. //Written by Anorrack//
* **[[[scp-8891|SCP-8891 - Nervous Tick]]]** -- Between 1994 and 1996, the Yuelao EX® implant was marketed as a panacea for disability. Now it's obsolete -- and hundreds of patients face a terrible fate. //Written by Tsercele and Anorrack//
* **[[[the missile knows where it is]]]** -- The missile knows what it is because it knows what it isn’t. //Written by Intercedent//
* **[[[Funeral for the Phoenix]]]** -- //[[[crowne-thorne-hub|Crowne of Thornes]]]// -- Florence Thorne was the greatest battlemage of her generation. Now she's gone. //Written by GreenWolf//
* **[[[Haunted by the Living]]]** -- //[[[crowne-thorne-hub|Crowne of Thornes]]]// -- Thorne receives a gift from Spencer, and answers from Kartal. //Written by Greenwolf//
* **[[[much-belated-inheritance|A Much Belated Inheritance]]]** -- //[[[crowne-thorne-hub|Crowne of Thornes]]]// -- Thorne enlists the help of Nemo and Jordan Raybon to take back something that should belong to them. //Written by Greenwolf//
* **[[[Memory of a Murder]]]** -- //[[[crowne-thorne-hub|Crowne of Thornes]]]// -- Thorne remembers. //Written by Greenwolf//
* **[[[Talking to Someone Else]]]** -- //[[[varuna-s-war|Varuna's War]]]//-- //Written by Anorrack//
* **[[[scp-8842|Archival Document — SCP-8842 — Another Nazi Wonderweapon]]]** -- //Written by Anorrack//
